comments.value: so that switching between blogs, scrolling through the 5 homepage promos, and scrolling through the sponsor logos at the bottom appear as different events.
do you also want to track the video/web cam header clicks?

Sure.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

category (required)
The name you supply for the group of objects you want to track.
action (required)
A string that is uniquely paired with each category, and commonly used to define the type of user interaction for the web object.
label (optional)
An optional string to provide additional dimensions to the event data.


Here's how it's to be implemented:
Homepage promos: Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: '1', '2', '3', '4' or '5'
News/blog: Category: 'newsblog', Action: 'switch', Label 'news', 'blog'
Funders: Category: 'funders', Action: 'carousel', Label 'left', 'right'
Partners: Category: 'partners', Action: 'carousel', Label 'left', 'right'
Webcams/Videos: Categroy: 'webcamsvideos', Action: 'switch', Label: 'webcams', 'videos'
Videos: Category: 'video', Action: 'play', Label: video url (Further events as lightbox goes live)

Sounds v sensible.

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

Two minor changes: 1) we unfortunately can't easily track video plays, so that's not in. 2) In the case of the promo, the labels arent 1-2-3-4 but the title of the current promo box.
Data started to appear as of yesterday, and promo data today morning.
https://www.google.com/analytics/reporting/event_objects?id=3492254&pdr=20100209-20100209&cmp=average

I understand 1) about vids - we'd need to ask BigButton I supposed. I'm
confused about the 4 boxes though. They are 'banners' 10-50 in the CMS.
Is something else the problem?

 

I'll go check out the data!

 

Liz Goulding

New Media Producer

London Organising Committee of the Olympic Games and Paralympic Games

Direct line: +44 (0) 203 2012 297

Switchboard: +44 (0) 203 2012 000

www.london2012.com  

www.twitter.com/london2012team

________________________________

Let me clarify:
Instead of
Homepage promos: Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: '1', '2', '3', '4' or '5' 

We are tracking

Homepage promos:
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Photos: Olympic Village taking shape'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Go for gold'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Olympic Park parklands project underway'
Category: 'promo', Action: 'switch', Label: 'Photos of the week'

So instead of the not too meaningful 1, 2, 3, 4 labels we're using the title of the promo - when a new promobox is added, its title will be picked up. See here:
https://www.google.com/analytics/reporting/event_object_action_detail?id=3492254&pdr=20100209-20100209&cmp=average&d1=promo&d2=switch&tab=0&view=0&tchcol=0

comments.value: The autocomplete isn't working when trying to edit the metadata of pictures

Hi Amy,

Which field(s)?

Jamie

All of them I think...

 

 

________________________________

From: Jamie Unwin [mailto:notifications-support@postcms.zendesk.com] 
Sent: 09 December 2009 16:35
To: Amy Holmes
Subject: [PostCMS support] Re: Photo metadata

The 'Photo page' template
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/coder/Photo%20page.template

Uses Master wide, which has a location field with a taxonomy
<content:string name="location" taxonomy="locations" isMetaData="true"/>

But in the Photo interface the auto complete doesn't work?
http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/picture/edit/images/media-manager/2009/12/view-of-the-work-be-carried-out-on-the-m-66510.jpg

Maybe it was just never coded for in that screen?

This screen is editing an image, not a page! There is no way to attach an autocomplete to an asset type attribute: I think this would actually require a new db column. I'm assigning it back to you so you can think about if that's something we want to put time into.

Alternate possibility: hardcode an "if new2012" check into the code...

Hi Amy,

Hi Deborah,

They never have auto competed, it's because the autocomplete only works (and was only ever coded to work) on actual pages not assets (like PDF's and images). The reason  being that none of the navigation, tag clouds and searches on the site uses the metadata on assets instead they all use the metadata on the Photo pages. 

The only reason we even have metadata field on Images is kind of a legacy reason, if we dropped them tomorrow the site would continue to work as normal.

btw. what is it you (or Amy) are you trying to edit? 

If it's the ALT text then yes you will want to do it on the actual image (as the image will then get pulled into pages).

But otherwise update the Photo pages that site in /Photos;  go to /Photos/2010 etc and edit the page and the metadata on the page. 

Photo's get automatically pulled in to other pages/tag clouds etc. based on the meta data on the Photo page /not/ the metadata on the Image (ie. the JPG) itself.

So..

ALT text -> edit the image in the gallery view http://new2012.kitsite.com/kit/files/pictures/
Meta data -> edit the Photo page itself in /Photos/2010 as this is the metadata that is used to drive navigation / searches on the site.

Ah.

 

Was me being a bit stupid (forgot that pics now automatically get
published, so didn't actually have to go to file/pictures at all.)

 

The ALT does come through from getty, right?

location, etc they set up in the same way we have ours. Is that not
true? (see how it's come through below)

 

d

itself)

Tried registering on the site with this address: goulding.liz@gmail.com
and got an "address already in use" message.
But searching for this email in the UMS does not return any results.

It's because your expired

kadmin@db2.LIVE> select  is_expired  from person  where email_address = 'goulding.liz@gmail.com';

IS_EXPIRED
----------
	 1

So the next question is how can you un-expire users?

I guess we'll have to create an interface for you to find and un-expire users *or* allow expired users to re-register. 

Neither is trivial to implement (in terms of can we do it today) will have a think about the best solution. The problem is we still have the old account in the CMS there account is just expired.

Do we want to allow expired users to re-register as a new user or should it reinstate their old account. Still thinking which would be easier, maybe if someone who has previously expired their account tries to re-register we could present them with a 'do you want to reinstate your old account page' but then we'd also need to verify it was their account somehow. Maybe we coudl just reinstate it and then bounce them back to the normal login page to login or get a password reminder.

Jamie

Thinking about this 

1) Normal users can't expire their accounts so this should never actually become a problem for normal users

2) If they can in future then the "Your email address is already in our database so you have previously created a profile on the London 2012 website. Please log in, or reset your password if you have forgotten it." page could just un-expire them (as long as they we're expired for a reason)

comments.value: Follow up to this morning's conference call

Hi Morag,

Attached are three routes as PDF flowcharts, sorry I probably should have mocked these up first before yesterdays meetings, so we could have discussed the various pros and cons and how they affect what you ant to do both now and in the future.

(sorry this is a lot to take in, feel free to call me to discuss, I just want to make sure we chose the best route for you before we start looking further at exact API's / who does what etc.)

thanks

ps. I haven't sent these to CommCorp yet, though best to get your feedback and decide is any are just non-starters or additions needed, before asking them to comment further.

Jamie

I think my preference would be Route 1 keeping the data / mailing list preferences in the main site / UMS and  creating a nicer way for you to export any given list to Communicator Corp from within the UMS interfaces (as this give you the most control/ flexibility going forward).

Although you may prefer Route 3 whereby we send a mini profile across to Communicator Corp each time a user either i) registers and confirms their email or ii) updates their details. The two things to be aware of if we go down this route are i) that if you later on add a new field to the user profile you won't be able to export users based on that field to Communicator core without changes to both Communcator Corps data model and the API between the UMS and CommCorp and ii) there may also be a cost involved in getting CommCorp to set up a more advanced profile (so that they can hold mailing list preferences and additional user data such as Location). In the route the actual mailing list preferences are still managed form the main site.

The second Route 2 works on the basis that we drop all mailing lists from the main site and just send users to CommCorp to manage their mailing list preferences, this is very much a bare bones / basic integration. It assumes the main site now knows nothing about mailing lists or email (other than that a user has confirmed their address). If we need to keep Name, Location etc. in sync we will need to build additional API's (very much like those described in route 3)

Route 1
----------
- Profile and register page for all data (including mailing lists) stays at www.london2012.com / UMS
- Slicing / dicing of users to mail happens in the UMS/CMS (we will improve the interface to allow this to be a near seamless process, if this route is chosen)
- Unsubscribes are handled back at the main site (and in future export these users wont' be sent across if they have unsubed from a given list)
- Main site will know about about email preferences and/or bounces
- Replies to emails are the same in all routes, LOCOG need to decide if an automated email with help / common questions / how to unsub will suffice or if a more personal response need to be sent and if so if that is a manageable task.

Route 2
----------
- We move all mailing list signup to a 3rd party page on CommCorp
- Integration between the two may give a bad experience
- Changes to the UMS wont' be reflected in CommCorp
- Main site won't know anythign about email or bounces

Route 3
----------

- Similar to Route 1 in many way, but instead of exporting a list of users to CommCorp before a mailout is sent we will continually export data to CommCorp (in effect CommCorp becomes a slave databse)
- May incur additional costs at CommCorp to hold a more complex data model
- Changes to the main UMS data model won't be reflected automatically in CommCorp will require new dev work each time this happens.

Jamie
Jamie, presumably the documentation is not an 8-point job. Do you want to close this task and open a new one for implementation. thanks!
